title: Dr. Koch's monster
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131055505im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Metroplo_6459.jpg)
  
Koch Antiqua (1923) and Kabel (1927)  
~

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131055505im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Rotwang_6097.jpg)
  
Laboratory of Rotwang the inventor, from _Metropolis_ (1927)  
~

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131055505im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lab0wi_5670.jpg)
  
Inside the lab  
~
author: Nick Shinn

comments.content: Kabel certainly was a popular font. My Kelsey catalogue has two knockoff versions of it - one of which, they note, doesn't have the same baseline as "real" Kabel while the other one does. And I even own an antique typewriter whose monospaced font is based on Kabel.

"Meine Dispatcher says zer is somesing wrong vis deine Kabel."  
—Karl Hungus, _Log Jammin'_

"Don't be fatuous, Jeffrey."  
—Maude Lebowski, _The Big Lebowski_
